name: CreateRumMetric
description:
Create a metric based on RUM data.

Use this tool to create a metric using your organization's RUM data via Datadog. It returns the metric object if successful.

parameters.name: rum_metric_definition
parameters.description: JSON object defining the new RUM-based metric, including attributes like compute rules, event type, and filters.

aggregation_type.description: The type of aggregation to use.

include_percentiles.description:
Toggle to include or exclude percentile aggregations for distribution metrics.
Only present when `aggregation_type` is `distribution`.

path.description:
The path to the value the rum-based metric will aggregate on.
Only present when `aggregation_type` is `distribution`.

compute.description: The compute rule to compute the rum-based metric.

event_type.description: The type of RUM events to filter on.

query.description: The search query - following the RUM search syntax.

filter.description: The rum-based metric filter. Events matching this filter will be aggregated in this metric.

path.description: The path to the value the rum-based metric will be aggregated over.

tag_name.description: Eventual name of the tag that gets created. By default, `path` is used as the tag name.

group_by.description: The rules for the group by.

when.description: When to count updatable events. `match` when the event is first seen, or `end` when the event is complete.

uniqueness.description: The rule to count updatable events. Is only set if `event_type` is `sessions` or `views`.

attributes.description: The object describing the Datadog rum-based metric to create.

id.description: The name of the rum-based metric.

type.description: The type of the resource. The value should always be rum_metrics.

value_schema.description: The definition of the new rum-based metric.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.
